title: AttributeError : can't set attribute when attempting to run brownie test
body:
### Environment information

* `brownie` Version: 1.12.2
* `ganache-cli` Version: 2.5.4
* `solc` Version: 6.12.0
* Python Version: 3.8.3
* OS: linux fedora 33

### What was wrong?

Please include information like:

tried running
```brownie test```
on a previously working project. I now get this error :
```
INTERNALERROR> Traceback (most recent call last):
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/_pytest/main.py", line 265, in wrap_session
INTERNALERROR>     config._do_configure()
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/_pytest/config/__init__.py", line 982, in _do_configure
INTERNALERROR>     self.hook.pytest_configure.call_historic(kwargs=dict(config=self))
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/hooks.py", line 308, in call_historic
INTERNALERROR>     res = self._hookexec(self, self.get_hookimpls(), kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 93, in _hookexec
INTERNALERROR>     return self._inner_hookexec(hook, methods, kwargs)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/manager.py", line 84, in <lambda>
INTERNALERROR>     self._inner_hookexec = lambda hook, methods, kwargs: hook.multicall(
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 208, in _multicall
INTERNALERROR>     return outcome.get_result()
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 80, in get_result
INTERNALERROR>     raise ex[1].with_traceback(ex[2])
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pluggy/callers.py", line 187, in _multicall
INTERNALERROR>     res = hook_impl.function(*args)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/brownie/test/plugin.py", line 117, in pytest_configure
INTERNALERROR>     session = Plugin(config, active_project)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/brownie/test/managers/runner.py", line 153, in __init__
INTERNALERROR>     super().__init__(config, project)
INTERNALERROR>   File "/home/dante/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/brownie/test/managers/base.py", line 30, in __init__
INTERNALERROR>     config.rootdir = local(project._path)
INTERNALERROR> AttributeError: can't set attribute
```

This is neither related to Ganache (had the same error without ganache running at all), and I doubt this is solc related (tried several versions)

I also tried this on a completely empty new project. Simply running `brownie init` then `brownie test` will output the same error message.

Apologies if this is a simple misconfig on my part, but i cant figure it out. Thank you.
That's quite strange.  Can you please show me the output of `pip list` ? Guessing it might be related to a dependency.

Here is the output of pip list :

I think the issue is from using pytest `v6.2.1`.  Brownie strictly pins to `v6.0.1`, I know some changes happened in `v6.1` but I haven't yet had time to address them.  This is likely one of them.
yes, you're right. Dependency issues with pytest and several other pip packages. Thanks.
